intro: Fernandezia pseudominor, commonly known as the lesser fernandezia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Fernandezia pseudominor thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
